subject: Education
title: Exit Tickets: Two Minutes That Transform Teaching
description: One-minute skill: Exit Tickets: Two Minutes That Transform Teaching.

hook.text: At the end of class, students write one thing they learned and one question they still have. Simple. Powerful.

buildup.text: Exit tickets take under two minutes and give teachers instant insight into comprehension.

discovery.text: They reveal misconceptions before they solidifyâ€”catching errors while they're still easy to fix.

twist.text: The act of writing what you learned is itself a retrieval practice exercise that boosts retention.

climax.text: Teachers who use daily exit tickets adjust instruction in real time, not after the final exam.

punchline.text: Two minutes of checking beats two weeks of guessing.

quiz.question: Why are exit tickets effective for both teachers and students?
options: They reveal misconceptions early and provide retrieval practice for students
They replace the need for any other assessment
They are required by education law
